note.p: Birth: Verval, County Wicklow, Ireland (16 November 1754)

Career: Worked for the HEIC (1770); Secretary to the government of Sumatra (for 8 years during the 1770s); established an East India agency business, Gower Street, London; Secretary to the Admiralty until his resignation (1795-1807); friend of Sir Joseph Banks
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 1. 1731-1847' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 307-332
D Carr Agnew, 'Robert Fitzroy and the myth of 'Marsden Square': Transatlantic rivalries in early marine meteorology' in NR 2004 vol 58 pp 21-46
